userStories.question: Besides medications, what else has worked for you?
userStories.tip: I've realized that emotional flare-ups bring on new sores, so I need to stay cool and use my head rather than flare up in anger or get upset over nothing important.

userStories.question: Whatâ€™s your best coping strategy?
userStories.tip: To remind myself that this is simply a skin condition in a highly inconvenient location. A cold sore that traveled south. And that it will not kill you.

condition.description:
Genital herpes is a sexually transmitted disease (STD) caused by a herpes simplex virus (HSV). It can cause sores on your genital or rectal area, buttocks, and thighs. You can get it from having sex, even oral sex. The virus can spread even when sores are not present. Mothers can also infect their babies during childbirth.

Symptoms of herpes are called outbreaks. You usually get sores near the area where the virus has entered the body. They turn into blisters, become itchy and painful, and then heal. Sometimes people do not know they have herpes because they have no symptoms or very mild symptoms. The virus can be more serious in newborn babies or in people with weak immune systems.

Most people have outbreaks several times a year. Over time, you get them less often and the symptoms become milder. The virus stays in your body for life.

Medicines do not cure genital herpes, but they can help your body fight the virus. This can help lessen symptoms, decrease outbreaks, and lower the risk of passing the virus to others. Correct usage of latex condoms can reduce, but not eliminate, the risk of catching or spreading herpes.

NIH: National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases
condition.name: Genital herpes

carousel_items: Works the best when taken as early as possible during an outbreak.
Drink plenty of fluids and stay hydrated while on Valtrex.
If you're taking this for herpes, use condoms and avoid sex if you're having an outbreak so you don't infect others.
Start taking Valtrex as soon as you know you're going to have a breakout.
Can cause diarrhea, nausea, or weakness.
This isn't a cure for viral infections, but it'll help control infection breakouts.

basics.benefits_moa: Valtrex is an antiviral medication that stops viruses from growing. It shortens the amount of time infections like shingles, chickenpox, and herpes will last.
basics.bottom_line: Valtrex is good for treating viral infections like herpes, chickenpox, and shingles. It won't cure the disease, but it'll shorten the length of a breakout.
downsides: Valtrex is not a cure for herpes, chickenpox, or shingles. It will only shorten the time you have a breakout.

If you're taking Valtrex for herpes, you should use barrier methods (condoms) when you're having sex since you can still pass it on to other people, even if you're taking the medication and you're not in a breakout.

downsides_processed.orig: Valtrex is not a cure for herpes, chickenpox, or shingles. It will only shorten the time you have a breakout.

If you're taking Valtrex for herpes, you should use barrier methods (condoms) when you're having sex since you can still pass it on to other people, even if you're taking the medication and you're not in a breakout.

upsides: Used as a first-choice treatment for herpes, chickenpox, and shingles infections and breakouts.
Most people (including pregnant women) usually take the oral medication without experiencing any side effects.
Available as a generic, so it's relatively cheap.
Most people generally don't develop a resistance to Valtrex.
Works well for most people to shorten the duration of outbreaks.
You don't have to take this as often as other antiviral medications.

upsides_processed.orig: Used as a first-choice treatment for herpes, chickenpox, and shingles infections and breakouts.
Most people (including pregnant women) usually take the oral medication without experiencing any side effects.
Available as a generic, so it's relatively cheap.
Most people generally don't develop a resistance to Valtrex.
Works well for most people to shorten the duration of outbreaks.
You don't have to take this as often as other antiviral medications.

userStories.tip: I have had Herpes Simplex I for over 50 years and not until I took Valacyclovir HCL was my condition ever in control.  I have tried going off this medication and I immediately break-out.  So now I am taking 1/2 of a 500 mg dose daily.  This medication works for me, no side effects either.
I take it as needed for ulcers on my lip. Just take them when I know I'll be exhausted to prevent any sores!
Take daily dose in morning and have had no side effects.

Need to take it within a couple hours of when I first feel a cold sore coming on. If I wait longer than that, it's usually too late and the cold sore ends up coming out anyway but I do believe taking it later still lessens the severity.
taken with food but not necessary. I increase dosage to treat Herpes Zoster when I feel it coming on

drugs.name: Valtrex

carousel_items_processed.orig: Works the best when taken as early as possible during an outbreak.
Drink plenty of fluids and stay hydrated while on Valtrex.
If you're taking this for herpes, use condoms and avoid sex if you're having an outbreak so you don't infect others.
Start taking Valtrex as soon as you know you're going to have a breakout.
Can cause diarrhea, nausea, or weakness.
This isn't a cure for viral infections, but it'll help control infection breakouts.

risks_warnings.title: Kidney damage
risks_warnings.description: There have been reports of people on Valtrex who have had serious kidney damage. This is very rare. You'll want to drink plenty of fluids while you're on Valtrex.

description_processed.orig: There have been reports of people on Valtrex who have had serious kidney damage. This is very rare. You'll want to drink plenty of fluids while you're on Valtrex.

risks_warnings.title: Blood disorders
risks_warnings.description: It's possible to develop a serious blood disorder that can damage the liver. This is very rare and is more likely to happen in people who have a weakened immune system. Call your doctor immediately if you notice unusual bleeding or bruising, feeling very tired or weak, have dark urine, or notice that your skin or the whites of eyes have become yellow.

description_processed.orig: It's possible to develop a serious blood disorder that can damage the liver. This is very rare and is more likely to happen in people who have a weakened immune system. Call your doctor immediately if you notice unusual bleeding or bruising, feeling very tired or weak, have dark urine, or notice that your skin or the whites of eyes have become yellow.

risks_warnings.title: Confusion
risks_warnings.description: Elderly people are more likely to have more confusion while on Valtrex. Look for signs of tiredness, confusion, and even hallucinations if using this in elderly patients.

description_processed.orig: Elderly people are more likely to have more confusion while on Valtrex. Look for signs of tiredness, confusion, and even hallucinations if using this in elderly patients.

carousel_items: Works the best when taken as early as possible during an outbreak.
Drink plenty of fluids and stay hydrated while on Acyclovir.
If you're taking this for herpes, use condoms and avoid sex if you're having an outbreak so you don't infect others.
Start taking Acyclovir as soon as you know you're going to have a breakout.
Can cause diarrhea, nausea, or weakness.
This isn't a cure for viral infections, but it'll help control infection breakouts.

basics.benefits_moa: Acyclovir is an antiviral medication that stops viruses from growing. It shortens the amount of time infections like shingles, chickenpox, and herpes will last.
basics.bottom_line: Acyclovir is good for treating viral infections like herpes, chickenpox, and shingles. It won't cure the disease, but it'll shorten the length of a breakout.
downsides: Acyclovir is not a cure for herpes, chickenpox, or shingles. It will only shorten the time you have a breakout.

If you're taking Acyclovir for herpes, you should use barrier methods (condoms) when you're having sex since you can still pass it on to other people, even if you're taking the medication and you're not in a breakout.
You need to take this up to five times a day, so it can be inconvenient.

Works well for most people to shorten the duration of outbreaks.
